title: W02-1602

sentences.text: Coedition of a natural language text and its representation in some interlingual form seems the best and simplest way to share text revision across languages .
For various reasons , UNL graphs are the best candidates in this context .
We are developing a prototype where , in the simplest sharing scenario , naive users interact directly with the text in their language -LRB- L0 -RRB- , and indirectly with the associated graph .
The modified graph is then sent to the UNL-L0 deconverter and the result shown .
If is is satisfactory , the errors were probably due to the graph , not to the deconverter , and the graph is sent to deconverters in other languages .
Versions in some other languages known by the user may be displayed , so that improvement sharing is visible and encouraging .
As new versions are added with appropriate tags and attributes in the original multilingual document , nothing is ever lost , and cooperative working on a document is rendered feasible .

On the internal side , liaisons are established between elements of the text and the graph by using broadly available resources such as a LO-English or better a L0-UNL dictionary , a morphosyntactic parser of L0 , and a canonical graph2tree transformation .

Establishing a `` best '' correspondence between the '' UNL-tree + L0 '' and the '' MS-L0 structure '' , a lattice , may be done using the dictionary and trying to align the tree and the selected trajectory with as few crossing liaisons as possible .
A central goal of this research is to merge approaches from pivot MT , interactive MT , and multilingual text authoring .

Entity-unl_graph.label: UNL graphs
Entity-unl_graph.description: Interlingual representations of natural language texts, used for sharing text revisions across languages and facilitating cooperative working on multilingual documents.

Entity-this_context.label: this context
Entity-this_context.description: The scenario where United Nations Linguistics (UNL) graphs are used as the best candidates for sharing text revision across languages.

Entity-a_lo-english_or_better_a_l0-unl_d.label: a LO-English or better a L0-UNL dictionary
aliases: a LO-English or better a L0-UNL dictionary
Entity-a_lo-english_or_better_a_l0-unl_d.description: A resource that provides translations or mappings between English (L0) and Universal Networking Language (UNL), used to establish liaisons between elements of text and graph.

mentions.local_name: a LO-English or better a L0-UNL dictionary

Entity-unl-l0.label: UNL-L0
Entity-unl-l0.description: The UNL-L0 is an algorithm for converting natural language text into its representation in some interlingual form, specifically designed as a deconversion tool.

Entity-we_are_developing_a_prototype.label: We are developing a prototype
Entity-we_are_developing_a_prototype.description: A prototype for sharing multilingual documents across languages, allowing naive users to interact directly with text in their language and indirectly with an associated graph.

Entity-liaison_are_established_between_e.label: liaisons are established between elements of the text and the graph
aliases: liaisons are established between elements of the text and the graph
Entity-liaison_are_established_between_e.description: A connection or mapping established between elements of natural language text and its representation in the Universal Networking Language (UNL) graph, using resources such as dictionaries, parsers, and transformations.

mentions.local_name: liaisons are established between elements of the text and the graph

Entity-liaison_are_established_between_e.label: liaisons are established between elements of the text and the graph by using broadly available resources such as a LO-English or better a L0-UNL dictionary, a morphosyntactic parser of L0, and a canonical graph2tree transformation
aliases: liaisons are established between elements of the text and the graph by using broadly available resources such as a LO-English or better a L0-UNL dictionary, a morphosyntactic parser of L0, and a canonical graph2tree transformation
Entity-liaison_are_established_between_e.description: A process that establishes connections between elements of text and graphs using available resources such as dictionaries, parsers, and transformations.

mentions.local_name: liaisons are established between elements of the text and the graph by using broadly available resources such as a LO-English or better a L0-UNL dictionary, a morphosyntactic parser of L0, and a canonical graph2tree transformation

Entity-deconverter.label: deconverter
Entity-deconverter.description: A software tool responsible for converting UNL graphs into representations of natural language texts in various languages.

Entity-unl-tree.label: UNL-tree
Entity-unl-tree.description: A data structure representing a lattice that corresponds between UNL (Universal Networking Language) and L0, used for merging approaches from pivot machine translation, interactive machine translation, and multilingual text authoring.

Entity-deconverters_in_other_language.label: deconverters in other languages
Entity-deconverters_in_other_language.description: Software tools or systems used for converting UNL graphs into natural language texts, located outside of the current linguistic context.

Entity-l0-unl_dictionary.label: L0-UNL dictionary
Entity-l0-unl_dictionary.description: A reference vocabulary that maps elements of the text to their corresponding representations in an interlingual form (UNL graphs)

Entity-establishing_a__best__corresponde.label: Establishing a `` best '' correspondence between the '' UNL-tree + L0 '' and the '' MS-L0 structure '', a lattice, may be done using the dictionary and trying to align the tree and the selected trajectory with as few crossing liaisons as possible
aliases: Establishing a `` best '' correspondence between the '' UNL-tree + L0 '' and the '' MS-L0 structure '', a lattice, may be done using the dictionary and trying to align the tree and the selected trajectory with as few crossing liaisons as possible
Entity-establishing_a__best__corresponde.description: The process of establishing an optimal correspondence between UNL-tree + L0 structures and MS-L0 lattices by utilizing dictionaries and minimizing crossing liaisons.

mentions.local_name: Establishing a `` best '' correspondence between the '' UNL-tree + L0 '' and the '' MS-L0 structure '', a lattice, may be done using the dictionary and trying to align the tree and the selected trajectory with as few crossing liaisons as possible

Entity-coedition.label: Coedition
Entity-coedition.description: A method or concept for sharing text revisions across languages by coediting a natural language text with its representation in an interlingual form.

Entity-unl-l0_deconverter.label: UNL-L0 deconverter
Entity-unl-l0_deconverter.description: A software system responsible for converting UNL graphs into their original L0 language representation.

Entity-unl.label: UNL
Entity-unl.description: A standardized language or interlingua used for machine translation and natural language processing.

Entity-coedition_of_a_natural_language_t.label: Coedition of a natural language text
aliases: Coedition of a natural language text
Entity-coedition_of_a_natural_language_t.description: The process or act of creating an equivalent version of a natural language text that can be shared and revised across different languages.

mentions.local_name: Coedition of a natural language text

Entity-the_error.label: the errors
Entity-the_error.description: Mistakes or inaccuracies occurring during the process of converting an UNL graph into another language, which are likely due to issues with the graph rather than the deconverter.

Entity-text_revision_across_language.label: text revision across languages
Entity-text_revision_across_language.description: The process of revising texts across different languages, allowing for sharing and collaboration on a document while preserving its original content.

Entity-naive_user.label: naive users
Entity-naive_user.description: Uninformed or inexperienced individuals who interact directly with a text in their native language and indirectly with its representation as an interlingual graph.

Entity-a_morphosyntactic_parser_of_l0.label: a morphosyntactic parser of L0
Entity-a_morphosyntactic_parser_of_l0.description: A tool that analyzes the grammatical structure (morphosyntax) of text written in Language-0 (L0), used to establish liaisons between elements of the text and its representation as a graph.

Entity-on_the_internal_side.label: On the internal side
Entity-on_the_internal_side.description: The internal mechanism for establishing connections between elements of the text and its representation as an interlingual graph.

Entity-error_were_probably_due_to_the_gr.label: errors were probably due to the graph
aliases: errors were probably due to the graph

mentions.local_name: errors were probably due to the graph

Entity-the_associated_graph.label: the associated graph
Entity-the_associated_graph.description: A data structure representing a connection between a natural language text and its interlingual representation.

Entity-it_representation_in_some_interli.label: its representation in some interlingual form
aliases: its representation in some interlingual form
Entity-it_representation_in_some_interli.description: The concept of representing a natural language text in an intermediate, machine-readable format for sharing revisions across languages.

mentions.local_name: its representation in some interlingual form

Entity-cooperative_working_on_a_document.label: cooperative working on a document
Entity-cooperative_working_on_a_document.description: The collaborative process of editing and revising a multilingual text, allowing multiple users to contribute and track changes without losing any information.

Entity-lo-english.label: LO-English
Entity-lo-english.description: A LO-English dictionary used as a resource for establishing liaisons between elements of text and its representation in some interlingual form.

Entity-some_other_language_known_by_the_.label: some other languages known by the user may be displayed
aliases: some other languages known by the user may be displayed
Entity-some_other_language_known_by_the_.description: A list of languages supported or familiar to a user, which can display versions of text in those languages for collaborative editing purposes.

mentions.local_name: some other languages known by the user may be displayed

Entity-improvement_sharing_is_visible_an.label: improvement sharing is visible and encouraging
aliases: improvement sharing is visible and encouraging
Entity-improvement_sharing_is_visible_an.description: A feature of collaborative document editing where users can view and contribute to different language versions, fostering a sense of improvement sharing that is both visible and encouraging.

mentions.local_name: improvement sharing is visible and encouraging

Entity-new_version.label: new versions
Entity-new_version.description: Successive updates or revisions of a multilingual document, each with its own set of tags and attributes, allowing for cooperative working on the document without losing any information.

Entity-cooperative_working_on_a_document.label: cooperative working on a document is rendered feasible
aliases: cooperative working on a document is rendered feasible
Entity-cooperative_working_on_a_document.description: A collaborative editing process for multilingual documents, enabling multiple users to work together and share revisions seamlessly.

mentions.local_name: cooperative working on a document is rendered feasible

Entity-naive_user_interact_directly_with.label: naive users interact directly with the text in their language -LRB- L0 -RRB-
aliases: naive users interact directly with the text in their language -LRB- L0 -RRB-
Entity-naive_user_interact_directly_with.description: Naive users who are interacting with a natural language text in their native language.

mentions.local_name: naive users interact directly with the text in their language -LRB- L0 -RRB-

Entity-ms-l0_structure.label: MS-L0 structure
Entity-ms-l0_structure.description: A lattice structure that represents a correspondence between UNL-tree + L0 and MS-MS-L0, used for aligning tree and trajectory with minimal crossing liaisons.

Entity-version_in_some_other_language_kn.label: Versions in some other languages known by the user may be displayed
aliases: Versions in some other languages known by the user may be displayed
Entity-version_in_some_other_language_kn.description: A feature allowing users to view previous versions of text translated into different languages.

mentions.local_name: Versions in some other languages known by the user may be displayed

Entity-a_new_version_are_added_with_appr.description: The process of adding new versions to an original multilingual document while preserving its integrity.

mentions.local_name: As new versions are added with appropriate tags and attributes in the original multilingual document, nothing is ever lost

Entity-nothing_is_ever_lost.label: nothing is ever lost
Entity-nothing_is_ever_lost.description: The concept that all changes made to a multilingual document are preserved and can be tracked, allowing for collaborative editing and version control.

Entity-the_modified_graph.label: The modified graph
Entity-the_modified_graph.description: A graph that has been modified or updated, possibly as a result of text revision or error correction.

Entity-interlingual_form.label: interlingual form
Entity-interlingual_form.description: A standardized format or system for representing written texts in a way that can be easily translated, compared, or processed across different languages.

Entity-this_research.label: this research
Entity-this_research.description: The main objective or purpose of this study that aims to combine methods from pivot machine translation, interactive machine translation, and multilingual text authoring.

Entity-pivot_mt.label: pivot MT
Entity-pivot_mt.description: Pivot Machine Translation (MT), an approach that combines methods for merging techniques from machine translation, interactive machine translation, and multilingual text authoring.

Entity-canonical_graph2tree_transformati.description: A process that transforms a graph into its corresponding tree structure.

Entity-natural_language_text.label: natural language text
Entity-natural_language_text.description: A written or spoken expression of human communication

Entity-multilingual_document.label: multilingual document
Entity-multilingual_document.description: A written or printed work that contains text in multiple languages.

Entity-morphosyntactic_parser_of_l0.description: A software system that analyzes the grammatical structure of text in the L0 language.

Entity-graph.description: A mathematical representation of nodes connected by edges, used to visualize or organize data.

Entity-interactive_mt.label: interactive MT
Entity-interactive_mt.description: A method or approach that involves human-machine interaction to facilitate machine translation.

Entity-version_in_some_other_language.description: A collection of language-specific renditions or adaptations of information or data.

Entity-multilingual_text_authoring.label: multilingual text authoring
Entity-multilingual_text_authoring.description: The process of creating written content in multiple languages.

Entity--lrb-_l0_-rrb-.description: a notation system or formatting syntax for representing a natural language text in its original form

Entity-associated_graph.description: A visual representation of interconnected data or concepts.

Entity-text_in_their_language.label: text in their language
Entity-text_in_their_language.description: A written content or information expressed in a natural language.

Entity-document.label: document
Entity-document.description: A written or printed composition of words that conveys information, ideas, or messages.

Entity-text_revision.description: The process of revising written content

Entity-other_language.label: other languages
Entity-other_language.description: A set of human or computer languages excluding the primary language being referred to.

Entity-result_shown.description: A visual representation or display of information

Entity-a_central_goal.description: The primary objective or aim of this research project

Entity-result.label: result
Entity-result.description: The outcome or product of an action, process, or computation.

summary: Coedition of a natural language text and its representation in some interlingual form seems the best and simplest way to share text revision across languages . For various reasons , UNL graphs are the best candidates in this context . We are developing a prototype where , in the simplest sharing scenario , naive users interact directly with the text in their language -LRB- L0 -RRB- , and indirectly with the associated graph . The modified graph is then sent to the UNL-L0 deconverter and the result shown . If is is satisfactory , the errors were probably due to the graph , not to the deconverter , and the graph is sent to deconverters in other languages . Versions in some other languages known by the user may be displayed , so that improvement sharing is visible and encouraging . As new versions are added with appropriate tags and attributes in the original multilingual document , nothing is ever lost , and cooperative working on a document is rendered feasible . On the internal side , liaisons are established between elements of the text and the graph by using broadly available resources such as a LO-English or better a L0-UNL dictionary , a morphosyntactic parser of L0 , and a canonical graph2tree transformation . Establishing a `` best '' correspondence between the '' UNL-tree + L0 '' and the '' MS-L0 structure '' , a lattice , may be done using the dictionary and trying to align the tree and the selected trajectory with as few crossing liaisons as possible . A central goal of this research is to merge approaches from pivot MT , interactive MT , and multilingual text authoring .

Predicate-share.label: share
Predicate-share.description: To share refers to a process of making something accessible or available to others. It implies a transfer of ownership, control, or understanding from one entity (subject) to another (object), often with the intention of collaboration, communication, or mutual benefit.

Predicate-developing.label: developing
Predicate-developing.description: The predicate 'developing' indicates that the subject is actively creating or improving something towards its intended form or functionality. It implies a process of growth, refinement, or maturation from an initial state to a more advanced one.

Predicate-shown_as.label: shown as
Predicate-shown_as.description: Indicates a representation or visualization of something (the subject), which conveys its essence or characteristics to someone (implied by the context). The predicate 'shown as' establishes an equivalence between the subject and the object, suggesting that they share similar properties or attributes.

Predicate-sent_to.label: sent to
Predicate-sent_to.description: The predicate 'sent to' indicates a transfer or transmission of something (e.g. information, data, resources) from the subject to the object. It implies a directionality and movement of the thing being sent, often with an intention or purpose.

Predicate-due_to.label: due to
Predicate-due_to.description: The predicate 'due to' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the state or condition described by the subject exists as a direct result of, or in relation to, the entity or circumstance denoted by the object.

Predicate-may_be_displayed.label: may be displayed
Predicate-may_be_displayed.description: Indicates that the subject has a possibility or potential to display the object. This predicate suggests an opportunity for the subject's content, information, or representation to be presented in some way.

Predicate-so_that.label: so that
Predicate-so_that.description: The predicate 'so that' indicates a purpose or intention behind an action. It connects the subject (the entity performing the action) to the object (the outcome or result of the action), implying that the action is taken in order to achieve the specified goal.

Predicate-renders_feasible.label: renders feasible
Predicate-renders_feasible.description: The predicate 'renders feasible' indicates that the subject's actions or state enable or facilitate the object to be achieved, managed, or understood. In general, it suggests a causal relationship where the subject's involvement makes the object more accessible, manageable, or comprehensible.

Predicate-and.label: and
Predicate-and.description: The predicate 'and' indicates that two or more clauses are being joined together to form a single statement. It serves as a conjunction, connecting the subject and object by emphasizing their simultaneous existence, equivalence, or co-occurrence.

Predicate-corresponds_to.label: corresponds to
Predicate-corresponds_to.description: The predicate 'corresponds to' indicates a relationship where the subject (a linguistic representation or model) has an equivalent or analogous form, structure, or meaning with respect to the object. This connection suggests that there exists a mapping or alignment between the two entities, allowing for translation, transformation, or interpretation of one into another.

Predicate-is_to_merge_approaches_from.label: is to merge approaches from
Predicate-is_to_merge_approaches_from.description: This predicate indicates that the subject intends or aims to combine or integrate different methods, techniques, or perspectives (represented by the object) towards a unified goal. The phrase 'from' suggests a source or origin of these approaches being merged.

Predicate-are_used_for.label: are used for
Predicate-are_used_for.description: The predicate 'are used for' indicates that the subject (an entity or process) has a specific purpose or function related to the object. It describes how the subject is employed, utilized, or applied towards achieving some goal or outcome.

Predicate-are.label: are
Predicate-are.description: The predicate 'are' indicates a relationship of equivalence or similarity between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject and object share common characteristics, properties, or attributes, implying a sense of unity, coherence, or correspondence.

Predicate-are_used.label: are used
Predicate-are_used.description: Indicates a relationship where something (the subject) serves as a means or medium to achieve an end or fulfill a purpose, and that thing has been employed or utilized for this purpose.

Predicate-For_various_reasons__UNL_graph.label: For various reasons , UNL graphs are the best candidates **in this context** . We are developing a prototype where ...
Predicate-For_various_reasons__UNL_graph.description: This predicate indicates that the subject (e.g., 'We are developing a prototype') is selecting or recommending the object ('UNL graphs') as the best candidates for a specific purpose or context, which is further specified by the phrase 'in this context'.

Predicate-establish_liaisons_between.label: establish liaisons between
Predicate-establish_liaisons_between.description: To establish liaisons between means to create connections or relationships that facilitate communication and understanding between two entities (subject and object), typically by defining a common framework, mapping, or ontology. This predicate enables the subject to serve as an intermediary or bridge between the object's concepts, allowing for more effective interaction, translation, or integration.

Predicate-using.label: using
Predicate-using.description: The predicate 'using' indicates that the subject is employing or utilizing the object to achieve some purpose, accomplish an action, or facilitate a process. It implies a relationship of dependence, reliance, or exploitation between the subject and the object.

Predicate-represent.label: represent
Predicate-represent.description: To represent means to convey or depict a concept, entity, or idea through a medium, system, or framework. The predicate 'represent' establishes an association between its subject and object, indicating that the subject embodies, symbolizes, or instantiates the characteristics, properties, or essence of the object.

Predicate-develop.label: develop
Predicate-develop.description: The predicate 'develop' indicates that the subject has undergone or is undergoing a process of growth, improvement, or refinement towards the object. The object represents an idea, concept, plan, or product that is being transformed or enhanced by the subject's efforts.

Predicate-are_established.label: are established
Predicate-are_established.description: The predicate 'are established' indicates a connection or relationship between two entities (subject and object), where the subject has a defined, recognized, or formalized link with the object. This link can be conceptual, physical, or abstract in nature.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general category or concept represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object is one of instantiation, where the subject exemplifies or embodies the characteristics of the broader term.
